benchmark_details.name: OmniMMI (Omni Multi-modal Interaction Benchmark in Streaming Video Contexts)
benchmark_details.overview: OmniMMI is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the interactive capabilities of Omni Large Language Models (OmniLLMs) in streaming video contexts, covering streaming video understanding and proactive reasoning across six distinct subtasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and enhance the interactive capabilities of models processing streaming video data.

data.source: Curated dataset from YouTube and open-sourced video-audio data.

methodology.calculation: Average accuracy calculated across multiple subtasks.
methodology.interpretation: Defined by performance on tasks involving streaming video interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: Surprising drop in performance observed in multi-turn tasks across various models.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement calculated to ensure reliability.
